lenders.name: Carol
lenders.loan_because: Every little bit helps and everyone can help make a difference.

lenders.name: Bethany
lenders.loan_because: I know what it's like to have a goal and to need just a little help in reaching it.
lenders.occupational_info: I graduated from college last year and am just getting started in life. I'm working in an office where I answer phones, greet visitors, sort mail, etc.

lenders.name: James
lenders.loan_because: I am fortunate enough to be able do so.

lenders.name: St.Genevieve High School
lenders.loan_because: we can change the world!
lenders.occupational_info: We are students at a National School of Character.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: This is a real and practical way that we humans on this earth can help each other across the miles. We who are blessed need to be  a blessing to others. Helping people to help themselves is a wonderful opportunity.
lenders.occupational_info: I am "retired" business person but actively engaged in life and helping others through my time, talents and money.

lenders.name: Rebecca
lenders.loan_because: "Money is like manure; it's not worth a thing unless it's spread around." - Thorton Wilder

lenders.name: Jeanene & Rob
lenders.loan_because: We want to help.

lenders.name: The Worleys
lenders.loan_because: We live in the richest country in the world! Private citizens should share the wealth. Giving to kiva.org reflects our family values.
lenders.occupational_info:
Pat - music fundraiser and Beale Sreet Caravan radio show co-host.
Billie - Musician, actor and producer.
Violette - Superstar!

lenders.name: Cheryl and Mark
lenders.loan_because: We love the idea of connecting with entrepreneurs around the world!  Here's to a just global economy!
lenders.occupational_info: pastor and carpenter

lenders.name: Curtis
lenders.loan_because: Every human being should have a chance for a better life.
lenders.occupational_info: My company's software sends and tracks messages to hospital crisis teams via their workstations.

lenders.name: Traci
lenders.loan_because: I love people and what better way than to give others an opportunity to take care of themselves and their families!
lenders.occupational_info: I came from humble beginnings and think that we can never give too much!

lenders.name: Ryan
lenders.occupational_info: Coordinate a youth development program for high school students, and other educational programs for high school and college students.

lenders.name: Jen
lenders.loan_because: Microfinance is one of the very best ways to help others rise above poverty -- it gives people dignity, not charity.
lenders.occupational_info: I write materials for team building programs that teach business people better teamwork and cooperation.

lenders.name: Delana
lenders.loan_because: Sentiment without action is the ruin of the soul. -Edward Abbey

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: Amazing

lenders.name: Rajendra
lenders.loan_because: I want to help the needy!

lenders.name: Mary

lenders.occupational_info: Biblical studies professor

lenders.name: Bob and Lisa
lenders.loan_because: We Care

lenders.name: Gerald
lenders.loan_because: I think it is important to support those who are in greater needs than we are
lenders.occupational_info: My work consists of attracting american companies to set up an operation in the Province of Quebec

lenders.name: virginia
lenders.loan_because: God will help those that help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I insure cars and homes against collision, fire, theft of personal items etc.

lenders.name: Sergio
lenders.loan_because: the world's financial, capital markets are unbalanced/inefficient and microfinancing allows indigent people access to what they've been denied: economic muscle!
lenders.occupational_info: I help people learn Mathematics at a Community College. I also answer questions about college and assist students in all sorts of ways.

lenders.name: Raquel
lenders.loan_because: Everyone needs a little help now and then.
lenders.occupational_info: My family grows fruit that is shipped all over the world.

lenders.name: Elizabeth
lenders.loan_because: can't keep it unless you give it away.

lenders.name: Raymond
lenders.loan_because: I think this a great way to empower people for long term, measureable economic improvement.  The best way to change lives is to give people the tools they need to help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a firefighter and a registered nurse.  I have been on numerous overseas volunteer medical missions.

lenders.name: Eric
lenders.loan_because: It's so hard to reach people directly around the world who need help. Traveling keeps one focused on these individuals and the small amounts of capital really needed to make an enormous difference in their quality of life, health, and education. Kiva appears to meet this need beautifully.
lenders.occupational_info: I design and write publications (books, reports, advertising, packaging) and websites. I'm also a photographer and artist.

lenders.name: Lydia+Leo
lenders.loan_because: I feel for the underprivileged.

lenders.name: Sombit
lenders.loan_because: empowering others to reach their goals is the best gift I can give.

lenders.name: Debra
lenders.loan_because: My husband has his own business, so I know it is hard work,  and in my own small way I want to support people like him who work hard for a better life.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a biotech company that is going to be making ethanol to run automobiles

lenders.name: Andrew
lenders.loan_because: I feel it is necessary to use the money we have been blessed with to change the lives of people all over the world.

lenders.name: Nicole
lenders.loan_because: I admire the spirit of all of these entrepreneurs. I would like to help others on the path to a productive, abundant and joyous life.
lenders.occupational_info: I design and supervise the building of houses. I am also a professor at a local college helping to educate young designers.

lenders.name: Kathy
lenders.loan_because: There are a lot of people that need help.

lenders.name: Christopher
lenders.loan_because: The world has given much to me and the least I can do is offer others a chance to take advantage of their opportunities.

lenders.name: Stephanie
lenders.loan_because: I want to make the world a smaller place.
lenders.occupational_info: Advise companies on energy and finance issues.

lenders.name: Beverly

lenders.loan_because: I've seen first hand how difficult some people have it in the world.

lenders.name: nicole
lenders.loan_because: it makes sense.

lenders.name: Mary A.
lenders.loan_because: I've been so fortunate myself and I want to share with those less fortunate.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm an artist1

lenders.name: Jamie
lenders.loan_because: I like that I can help people help themselves

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: A small bit from me can make a big difference in the lives of other people.

lenders.name: Bill
lenders.loan_because: it is my new compulsion.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a professional member association, planning meetings, conferences, and schools for the association's members.

lenders.name: Benjamin

lenders.name: NorCal Family
lenders.loan_because: We are fortunate enough to be able to do so.

lenders.name: St Vincent de Paul
lenders.loan_because: Vic was an entrepreneur and helping others was what he believed in. He was an active member of St Vincent de Paul.

lenders.name: Kathryn
lenders.loan_because: I don't think people really want charity. Reputable microlending is a great way for those of us with a little extra to help out those, especially women, who need just a bit of cash to help them have some control of their economic futures. I help because I am a fortunate enough to be able to.

lenders.name: Rokhaya
lenders.loan_because: This a great opportunity to help out around the world. It is amazing to realize how helpful the money you lend can be to others. Coming from Africa, I am familiar with the poverty reality.
lenders.occupational_info: I am still at university doing my Masters in International Studies/Economic development. my area of interest is particularly Africa. I have done a great deal of researches in gender and development.

lenders.name: Heather
lenders.loan_because: I just want to help...  I never heard of Kiva until viewing a recent episode of Frontline World.  I tape the show and had one day to view it before it automatically erased.  Glad I watched it this evening!  I immediately signed up to help.

lenders.name: Judith
lenders.loan_because: I've need loans in the past too.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a large store that sells just about anything you can think of: clothing,food, tools etc

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: I should, I can, it gives me pleasure, it improves the world bit by bit and it's better than buying something that I don't really need.

lenders.name: Lyssa
lenders.loan_because: I want to raise my daughters to be aware of the rest of the world and that even small amounts help; therefore I try to lead by example.

lenders.name: Lani Fischer
lenders.loan_because: My name is Lani Fischer and for my 11th birthday my friends (Alaina, Morgan and Bernadette)and I put a loan together for Kiva.
lenders.occupational_info: We are 5th graders in Manhattan Kansas and Kiva is a great way to clelebrate a birthday!! gifts that keep on giving.

lenders.name: Benoit

lenders.name: Joan
lenders.loan_because: I should! I can!
lenders.occupational_info: Wonderful.

lenders.name: Linda

lenders.occupation: Climate scientist and Global Health Activist
lenders.loan_because: I loan on behalf of mothers and women, who have been so important in changing my life for the better, and who I believe channel future world peace, prosperity, and sustainable development.
lenders.occupational_info: I am trying to develop a better scientific understanding of how our planet -- as a unified system -- reacts to extreme climate change, and the fundamental forces that drive this climate change.

lenders.name: Kristell
lenders.loan_because: $25 I don't need to use this month  could be used by somebody else who does so why not loaning it...

lenders.name: Tom
lenders.loan_because: I am looking at innovative ways of using technology for humanitarian activities, and i like Kiva's model of connecting people more directly.
lenders.occupational_info: I retired from my first career in designing computer systems for hospitals to see what I could do to use computers for humanitarian and philanthropic uses.

lenders.name: Max (for Lilly)
lenders.loan_because: This is my second time lending.  I thought I could take the $50 I was going to use on presents for my 2-yr old niece's birthday and lend it to people in need instead.
lenders.occupational_info: I study environmental issues - particularly climate change.  After I graduate I will focus on expanding environmentally friendly construction practices to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from the construction and operation of buildings.

lenders.name: Laura

lenders.occupational_info: I am studying international development and public policy at Harvard University.  I am a humanitarian aid worker

lenders.occupational_info: i assist with the administration of an airplane museum.

lenders.name: Bernie & Lynnette
lenders.loan_because: it enables us to help in a small way those folks who have the will and energy but lack only the resources to improve their situation.

lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: DaleSu-FangEleanorRoz

lenders.occupational_info: Dale is an event coordinator for a prestigious university.  Su-Fang is an accountant with the US Department of Justice.  Eleanor is a retired librarian and also studied  physics.  Roz had a long career in the children's clothing business.

lenders.loan_because: It feels good to be able to help someone directly- and to see how I can make a change in someone's life.

lenders.loan_because: My loan was made possible by a Birthday Gift Certificate from dear friends.  I think it is important to help people become self-sufficient.

lenders.occupational_info: I am currently a student in International Studies and Political Science.  I will graduate in 2008.

lenders.name: Dale & Barb

lenders.name: Nancy
lenders.loan_because:
Microlending seems like a wonderful way to share my good fortune, and I hope my small contributions will make a difference in people's lives. 

Please note: The loan to "identity protected" in Kirkuk, Iraq, was made by members of my Middle Eastern History class (Summer 2007) at the University of North Texas. After it was fully paid back, I rolled it over to Mohamad in Lebanon. After he fully paid back his loan, I  rolled it over to Mazouza in Palestine. After she fully repaid her loan, I rolled it over to  Rana, also in Palestine. She's now paid her loan back, so I rolled it over to Abdelkareem in Palestine.  I hope to keep this money active as long as possible for loans to assist Middle Easterners, in honor of my students who raised the money initially. :)

lenders.name: Sunny
lenders.loan_because: In this way, I can help entrepeneurs grow their businesses, support their families with dignity, and help their communities, to ultimately provide us all with a better place to live.
lenders.occupational_info: I review documents that describe mechanical devices as part of applications for US patents.  Patents allow inventors to protect their ideas for a period of 20 years.   Many inventors are small business people who are constantly working to improve their products.

lenders.name: Seánan
lenders.loan_because:
I can. 

It is a pleasure to be able to make a change in the world, and to do so as an individual. Kiva enables me to show other people that this is possible. (This is but one reason I shall never form or join a group.)

lenders.name: Sarah
lenders.loan_because: This was a gift from our brother (in-law), and we went to Africa on our honeymoon.  We want to share our blessings with others in a way that promotes hard work & growth.

lenders.name: Les
lenders.loan_because: Its a great way to help people develop a business and help themselves and their communities
lenders.occupational_info: Photographer

lenders.name: Judy & Skip McGinty
lenders.loan_because: We were in the Peace Corps in West Africa and the Middle East in the late '60s and early '70s; and  appreciate the power of this network of lenders and borrowers..
lenders.occupational_info: Judy is a retired inner city middle school math and science teacher ...now focused on grand-mothering.   Skip is a health care consutlant; and also teaches health economics & policy to MBA students.  Judy and Skip split their time between Olympia, Washington and San Francisco.

lenders.name: Kelly
lenders.loan_because: I believe that everyone deserves a chance.

lenders.name: Yael
lenders.loan_because: I believe that everyone deserves a chance.

lenders.name: Sarah Otner
lenders.loan_because: My work is challenging, but I am continually grateful for the *privilege*.  I think that the value created by microfinance is greater than the value conveyed by compounded interest.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an academic in the field of management, with expertise in organizational behavior. I am also a Rotarian (D1130).

lenders.name: matthew
lenders.loan_because: i find that wealth is to be shared.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a special education teacher in new york city.

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: Microcredit is a powerful and effective tool for poverty amelioration.
lenders.occupational_info:
I have a Masters in Public Health Degree and my Masters Thesis was on the effect of Microcredit loans on maternal and child health in Tanzania. I am also a Rheumatologist(arthritis and autoimmune disease 
specialist )in Tucson, AZ.

lenders.name: Søren
lenders.loan_because: I feel responsible.

lenders.name: Nadine
lenders.loan_because: We have so much in our lives and have an obligation to help those who deserve more in theirs.  We have 2 sons and feel that teaching them to reach out to other people is the strongest action they can ever take.
lenders.occupational_info: I have worked with people with AIDS for 20 years.  I have worked to close youth prisons in Louisiana and now I am working on raising 2 beautiful boys and supporting my spouse who is becoming a doctor.

lenders.name: sabino & marisa
lenders.loan_because: It feels good to help others

lenders.name: Derrick
lenders.loan_because: I believe everyone should have the right to better their lives and the lives of their families, and become self-sufficient.

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: I want to help.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a consultant and I work to develop websites on the internet. I am also a dj and I mix all forms of music together.

lenders.name: Anne
lenders.loan_because: I like the idea of helping people one-on-one. Not long along ago, on the news program "Democracy Now!", I heard author Eduardo Galeano quote an engineer friend of his. His friend pointed out that nothing gets built from the top down except a hole. Everything else must be built from the ground up.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with the government of the State of Texas. We lease state property to companies so they can build solar farms, wind farms, and geothermal energy plants. We also help companies and local governments  switch their fleet vehicles from diesel to alternative fuels. And -- most exciting to me -- we co-host an annual forum for Mexico/US border states to share information and ideas about energy.

lenders.name: Laurie
lenders.loan_because: The world is too small and beautiful to pretend that we aren't each part of each other's lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I am learning to be a teacher of English to adults. I used to work with computers.

lenders.name: Jennifer
lenders.loan_because: I made my first contribution on Mother's Day in honor of the tremendous support that I have been lucky to have from my mom, Kris.

lenders.name: Tara
lenders.loan_because: Because life is about helping others.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in the Bone Marrow Transplant Clinic in Calgary, Alberta. I coordinate Bone Marrow Transplants/Stem Cell Transplants.

lenders.name: Bob & Charlene
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: Liz Wood
lenders.loan_because: My son gave me a wonderful Mother's Day present - a gift certificate to Kiva.  This is a great way to enjoy a holiday and help others. too.
lenders.occupational_info:
I help people prepare their tax
documents for the government.

lenders.name: Sherri
lenders.loan_because: I want to help others have a chance at a better life.

lenders.name: lenore
lenders.loan_because: We  have to do what we can to help each other. otherwise, we just take up space

lenders.name: Mary
lenders.loan_because: I have been fortunate to live in various countries including Nigeria and understand how microlending contributions can be helpful to people.  My family set up my account for Mother's day 2007.
lenders.occupational_info: I write software that helps make the process of producing oil and gas more efficient.  I look after my family (husband and three sons).  I am a keen gardener and grow a lot of the food we eat.

Spock - http://www.spock.com - is developing a search engine that helps users find and discover people. With over one hundred million people already indexed and millions added everyday, Spock is building the broadest and deepest people specific search engine.

The team has extensive experience in search from leading companies including Friendster, Netscape, Yahoo, and Microsoft. Spock has received over $8 million in investments to date from Clearstone Venture Partners and Opus Capital Ventures.

I also help people with nervous conditions caused by psychological traumas of childhood and adolescence. I use psychoanalytic, behavioral and systems theories as my guiding theoretical framework when doing psychotherapy and bio-neuro-pharmaco-medical science when there is a need to add medications.

lenders.occupational_info: I just finished my MBA from Babson and am launching a tech startup as well as consulting in the tech / social media space for a few brands. I am involved in the convergence of the technology, the Internet, new media, and music.....and I am trying to find a way to change the world I live in.

lenders.name: Beijo
lenders.loan_because: I can, even though I am retired on a fixed income. My strategy has been to loan $25 a month until the repaid loans would be coming back at the rate of $25 a month, then continue to reinvest. I was surprised that it took a short 8 months, and since then I have only been reinvesting. It is so much fun to see and hear from people all over the world! I don't recommend my stragegy if you can give more, but for me, it works well.

lenders.name: Patricia
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the people who have to work and support their families  in 3rd world countries .  We have to work as in concert with the world to feed and educate the children.  Hungry, poverty stricken, uneducated children do not make good world leaders.  This is one way to change the order of things to a more balanced, conscious society.

I want to make a difference in the world,

lenders.loan_because: If I am able to help, then I have a responsibility to do so.  Simple enough huh?  Wish more people thought that way.

lenders.name: Holly
lenders.loan_because: I have seen the beauty of many faces, many religons, many ways of life the world over.  One thing is clear: we are all the same. We all have the same hopes and dreams. If my little contribution can change someone's life, then I have made the world a better place.
lenders.occupational_info: I am interested in how people lived a long time ago. What did they look like? What was their art like? What types of things did they use everyday for farming, eating, jewelry, clothing? I dig in the ground for remnants of the things people left behind long ago.  If you do this carefully you can get a lot fo information from each layer of earth that you dig up. Sometimes I find broken pottery, glass, arrow heads, and beads. I have also found human and animal bones.  Human bones tell us a lot about how people lived. They can tell us their age, their health, and sometimes their status.  I find ancient and modern people very fascinating!

lenders.name: Kelly and David Funk
lenders.loan_because: Even small amounts of U.S. dollars can make a tremendous difference in the lives of others living in developing countries. And, it's the right thing to do...

lenders.name: edward
lenders.loan_because: I feel that it is a great way to give back and maybe, just maybe make the world a better place.

lenders.name: Kenia
lenders.loan_because:
I believe there is abundance in the world!  I am NOT anti-poverty; I AM pro-entrepreneurship, pro-business, pro-wealth.  I believe in the power of positive thinking, and in helping others not out of pity, but out of compassion and knowledge that there is plenty in the world to go around!

I stand behind the saying: "Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day.  Teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime."  Of course, one still needs to eat today before he manages to learn for himself in the future!  Kiva is essentially the way to give someone fish so that they may reach their business goals and fish for themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: Food Lover, Runner, Booklover.

lenders.name: Jenni
lenders.loan_because: everyone needs help and I respect those that work towards their goals.
lenders.occupational_info: Words, words, words

lenders.name: Molly
lenders.loan_because: I was lucky to be born in the US and raised with love, comfort and education.  Loaning to others in need is the least I can do to give back to the world that has given so much to me.
lenders.occupational_info: I help employees and companies who have disagreements with each other come to an agreement.

lenders.name: Megan
lenders.loan_because: I believe the individuals I lend to should have access to finance.
lenders.occupational_info: I was a Kiva Fellow in Cote d'Ivoire & Togo in 2008. And now I work at Kiva!

lenders.loan_because: I'm a Baha'i and I like to help others.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm an account director for an interactive advertising agency.

lenders.name: Secretagentmarky

I have seen first hand how hard it is to get a business started and for me this is a great way to give a little something back and hopefully give someone a little help to improve their businesses and their quality of life.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm very lucky. I work to live and as soon as I have enough I'm off to somewhere new to explore. I love to walk and am just about to begin (June 1st 2007) a walk from the furthest point North of Europe to the furthest point south

lenders.occupational_info: I work with businesses to help them understand their financial performance

lenders.name: Mikko

Thanks to Kiva ("Nice" in Finnish, by the way :) for enabling people around the world to instead spur people into helping themselves and their society.
lenders.occupational_info: I manage GNU/Linux computer systems and communications networks at the University of Helsinki. This might not mean much to most people, sorry, but I don't know how else to put it. I do hope that the One Laptop Per Child project will make both GNU/Linux computers and computer networking, among other things, more familiar to also people in poorer countries.

lenders.occupational_info: I help to maintain three historic live theaters in Portland, Oregon, USA.  These theaters host nearly 1000 events each year that entertain and enrich the lives of tens of thousands of people all over our region.

lenders.occupational_info: helping people find jobs and then training them to be successful

lenders.name: Linda
lenders.loan_because: I watched Black Gold and China Blue on Independent Lens and realized how interdependent my life is with people around the world that provide our goods. I wanted to give back to in some small way.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people get books and learn how to use computers at a library.

lenders.name: Bruce
lenders.loan_because: but for the grace of god go I
lenders.occupational_info: I write computer software for animated movies.

lenders.name: Katherine
lenders.loan_because: life is full of many beautiful gifts that we should all share.

lenders.name: Randy and Nancy
lenders.loan_because: We've just returned to the US after riding our bicycles through Latin America and meeting the people - it's nice to participate with them a bit.
lenders.occupational_info: We rode from "the north pole to the south pole", from the far north of Canada (Inuvik, in Northwest Territories) Argentina in South America.

lenders.name: Mahesh
lenders.loan_because:
*To help someone succeed in life
*This concept fascinates me
lenders.occupational_info: Doing my PhD in Mechanical Engineering

lenders.name: Atticus
lenders.loan_because: I like helping people and when they get the money and email me, I feel happy because they are using the money I sent to help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: Learning new things and practicing old things so that I really remember the old things.

lenders.name: Quevin LLC
lenders.loan_because: I like to know where my money is going, and not to a generalized cause. Kiva allows me to identify exactly what it is I want to contribute to, and actually see long-term results.
lenders.occupational_info:
Personalized Web Design, Development &
Expert Drupal CMS Customization
In the San Francisco Bay Area

lenders.name: Stephen
lenders.loan_because: Loans can make a difference.

lenders.name: Zoe and Dre
lenders.loan_because: We decided to use the money we had set aside for party favors for  our wedding guests to make recurring loans to entrepreneurs through Kiva. We have made four loans to date, and plan on continuing to loan the repaid money forever.
lenders.occupational_info: Zoe is a lawyer and Dre recently started his own business - Capital Kombucha, which was one of the first companies to raise money using Kiva's new Zip program.

lenders.name: Edgar
lenders.loan_because: I have been blessed and want to share my good fortune with others.  I taught Economics/Free Enterprise for 15 years.  I want to help all I can to have a better life through ingenuity and work.  I believe in those I have seen on this site.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach World History in a high school, but I taught Economics/Free Enterprise for 15 years.

lenders.name: Markus
lenders.loan_because: It's just the right thing to do....

lenders.name: Susan
lenders.loan_because: it is helpful.

lenders.name: Melanie
lenders.loan_because: What could be more satisfying than helping hardworking folks grow their businesses and prosper?

lenders.name: Judith
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do;  and I love the idea that I can make a difference in someone's life.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm retired now, but for 32 years  I supervised a word processing center in an urban school district. I also taught typing  in adult night school.

lenders.name: jeff
lenders.loan_because: its my way of making a difference
lenders.occupational_info: advise and mentor business leadership teams

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: It's a great way to "give" to charity.  In my mind, education and hard work ultimately result in social equity and opportunity.  Microfinance helps support hard work, and for parents might help send more kids to school to increase their social opportunities.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a graduate student studying fuel cells.  I hope to teach college within in the next 3-5 years.  The picture is my daughter.

lenders.name: Jose R.
lenders.loan_because: I believe on the principle of support private initiative as the foundation to freedon
lenders.occupational_info: Project Manager on the Oil, Gas and Petrochemical Industries

lenders.name: Jeffrey
lenders.loan_because:
this is one of the ways in which I am "paying it forward."  
"Think of an idea for world change, and put it into action."
lenders.occupational_info: I was a Peace Corps Volunteer in Ghana in the 1980's.

lenders.name: JAMIE
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do and it feels great to help someone.

lenders.name: Jed
lenders.loan_because: I'd like to help people out but I don't have a lot of disposable income so this seems like a good way to help a lot of people with the small amount of money I can contribute.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an environmental and forensic scientist for a non-profit natural gas research institute.

lenders.name: MC_Glick
lenders.loan_because:
1) I like to help people who want to help themselves.

2) Kiva lets me be an alternative to the usurious loans that apparently dominate in developing countries.

3) I'm opposed to government foreign aid that goes to kleptocracies and ineffective (or even destructive) big-budget projects and rarely filters down to those who truly need it.

4) Business is the free exchange of goods and services between people. If anything makes the world go round, that is it, so I try to enable it.

5) Kiva.org lets people decide for themselves how they will work and use the funds, rather than telling them how or what to do, like some "Fair Trade" and other similar top-down organizations.

6) I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I taught English to Japanese college students as well as wrote articles, most frequently about materials design. Occasionally I engage in contractual work, usually proofreading English texts. At present I study engineering and tutor math.

lenders.name: Marc,Jane, Matt & Claire
lenders.loan_because: We want to help people help themselves, and we want to share our good fortune.

lenders.name: Tom
lenders.loan_because: God has blessed me. I hope to spread this blessing to others and at the same time hope to spread the Good News, that Jesus Christ has died for you, and all you have to do is invite him into your heart.
lenders.occupational_info: I design and create newer and faster computers.

lenders.name: hilaria
lenders.loan_because: for business
lenders.occupational_info: small sari sari / retail store

lenders.name: Shari
lenders.loan_because: I come from a poor family, but with a little help, I made it out ok. I love to travel now and I want to make the world a better place.
lenders.occupational_info: I work at a coffee shop in the city. I'm also a college student. I love it!

lenders.name: Carolinka
lenders.loan_because: I can, at this micro level
lenders.occupational_info: assisting attorney at an NGO represent clients negotiating the byzantine labyrinth of bureaucracy involved in family and refugee/asylee based immigration to the USA.

lenders.name: Anamaria
lenders.loan_because: It's pretty inspiring to see all these entrepreneurs out there in the world who are trying to chase new opportunities and cultivate the ability to choose their own course of development.  Not every individual has a true entrepreneurial spirit---so it's great to be able to contribute and support some special individuals who do.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with mining companies to help them improve their social and environmental performance. (In short, I help them "behave better.") Really though---I work with companies on how to do community engagement and community development in a way that is strategic and makes sense for the business, but also ultimately has true social impact in the host communities where these companies operate.

lenders.name: Blaine
lenders.loan_because: All people deserve to live a happy and healthy life!

lenders.name: Ken
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do.
lenders.occupational_info: I raise corn, soybeans, oats, hay and wheat on a small organic farm.

lenders.name: ann
lenders.loan_because: I'd like to help change the world, one small donation at a time.I'd like to believe  poverty and despair are unacceptable no matter your income, your place of origin, no matter your color and no matter your age.
lenders.occupational_info: I retired from Fed Ex, then opened a small aromatherapy shop,.

lenders.name: Heidrun
lenders.loan_because: I love it to make a difference. The amount of money that I loan buys so much more than in my own country.
lenders.occupational_info: I am developing software for a living. I also write novels, screenplays, and manuals for mental training.

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: I believe everyone should.
lenders.occupational_info: I design advertisements for print (mostly for newspapers).

lenders.name: Kevin
lenders.loan_because: I like helping people build sustaining businesses for themselves, because no one likes to be pitied. Teaching people skills and helping to start a new business goes leagues further than handing over a blank check.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm an entrepreneur with an avid interest in web and mobile technologies. I program software, write business documentation, collaborate with talented people, and build useful products for helping people discover the things they'll truly love.

lenders.name: Ted
lenders.loan_because: I want to help make a difference in somebody's life and the place that they live.
lenders.occupational_info: I manage a unit within an oil refinery that produces diesel, jet fuel, gasoline, and other petrochemical products
